meanings.definition: A condition in which the two eyes have unequal refractive power.
meanings.sent1: Anisometropia can cause one eye to see things differently than the other.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist diagnosed her with anisometropia after noticing the difference in refractive power between her eyes.
meanings.sent3: The anisometropia in his eyes made him feel like he was living in a funhouse mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her anisometropia was like having one eye look through a magnifying glass while the other used a telescope.
meanings.sent5: The anisometropia in his vision was like trying to focus a camera with one lens clear and the other blurry.

meanings.definition: The presence of unequal refractive errors in the two eyes.
meanings.sent1: She struggled with anisometropia, causing her to wear glasses with different prescriptions for each eye.
meanings.sent2: Anisometropia can lead to difficulties in perceiving depth and distance accurately.
meanings.sent3: His anisometropia was so extreme that he joked about having a 'superpower' to see things differently.
meanings.sent4: The anisometropia in her eyes was like having two cameras with different focus settings.
meanings.sent5: The anisometropia affected her vision like wearing two different strength reading glasses at the same time.
